definition: mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

sentences.english: Yilin Gaicuo(Correction on the Errors of Medical Works)is a work of WANG Qing-ren in Qing dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《医林改错》是清代医家王清任的著作。

sentences.english: So I asked her to write down those three words in her correctional notebook.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我让她把那三个单词记在改错本上。

sentences.english: I can learn from my mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 我可以通过改错改善学习。

sentences.english: Do you know how to correct the mistakes?
Secondly, the number of sample subjects doing all those 12 ECs is too small.
sentences.chinese: 第二，12篇综合改错全做的学生偏少。
老师为什么要鼓励学生自己改错呢？

definition: (of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
to fill a job vacancy/to fill in a blank (e.g. on questionnaire or exam paper)
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]
to mark (homework, exam scripts etc)/to correct and criticize (an article)/to check/to correct/a correction (to a piece of writing)
